Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: rim glazed; wall reserved with single black line; exterior: lip and handle zone reserved with line between; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type B3
Curator's comments: Schlotzhauer identifies the sherd as coming from a Type 9C South Ionian cup with everted rim. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana or Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type X (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116) and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup type B3 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus.
The piece should be of roughly the same date as the other known dedication by Phoinix, on 1911,0606.30, which is not later than 550 BC and probably earlier.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 823, pl. XXI, no. 823)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 689, no. 471)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 52, no. 279)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.709) (Phase 3)
